answers.answer: "I went to a doctor who specializes in autonomic disorders who insists that all the above symptoms are due to my diabetes.  My endrocronologist disagrees. "Your Endo specializes in diabetes treatment, among other things. Since you kept it a secret as to who/what your Endo tested you for, what this other doctor practices, or what other doctors you have seen and what their findings were you made it difficult to comment.Look at this http://www.nlm.nih.gov/medlineplus/ency/article/000313.htm

question: I was recently diagnosed with Diabetes Type 2.  I have been suffering from dizziness, fainting, lack of appetite, nausea, weight loss and low blood presure, despite the fact that my glucose count is between 98-135 and I am very cautious about a proper diet to keep the glucose in check.I went to a doctor who specializes in autonomic disorders who insists that all the above symptoms are due to my diabetes.  My endrocronologist disagrees.Have
title: Can Diabetes Type 2 cause a wide range of symptoms?
